title: Frameworks and Applications for Logistics
segmentation: While I'm fixing the technology here, I would like to make a little observation, namely that this morning session has a representation of Italy, Germany, Norway, Greece and United States.
Who is the high school afforded Agabus?
Said permits broke so I can skip sick people.
They are back on Skype for Asylum Support OS here.
Some of you dude.
Some of you do, but there are a number of people who don't.
So what have we done?
We have.
We have adopted English as our framework for communication in this conference.
I'm not sure what we are talking about in relation to.
Um?
Logistics and supply chain and activities where we have a number of companies involved in the process is exactly that.
Communication question is how we do it.

And before venturing into that for many years and still is a non EU ambition to have these types of transport chains be competitive with these very simple chains, from door to door, for intra, European European transport, and obviously when we talk about global change they are on the top there where many people are involved.
However lately there is very little indication.
That all of the things we've been doing in the past has taken very much cargo off roads for entropy and activities from Rd to other modes.
Obviously we have had container featuring growing extensively, so it's not a very.
Very dark picture.
However, this is still not happening to the event that we would like to have.
When we are also speaking about framework, many of us use the word intermodal and in principle that means full container loads.
You fill up a container, you seal it and it goes through a chain, shifting modes and then ends up as a full container.
That's not solving the issue because there are many situations whereby we have curtains being mounted on pallets being put into boxes, being transported as boxes, billing split again.
Consolidated a new and when we are talking about communication here, we need to talk about communication in that total process, not just to fill container load from one end to the other.
We are dealing with technologies and I will not touch much upon that, but when we are looking at the as a framework as a means of communication information exchange, we cannot.
Do that based on a certain type of technology.
It has to be technology independent.
It also has to be culture independent and it does not have to be in such a way that I am that if you want to communicate you're forced to do certain things in a certain way.
You have to communicate in a certain way, but the way that I'm prepare.
Bring my presentation here and the way anybody else is preparing that their presentation.
The business process is behind it is there.
And mine, but my message my communication to you is something that I share.
In order for all these types of activities to hang together, we need interoperability.
The keynote indicated that very clearly.
And.
He also underlined what I see there as as my title, interoperability is an illusion.
If it wasn't an illusion, you wouldn't have a business.
Question though, is that despite all these things with all these standards, with all these things that are going on, interoperability is still illusion and.
I will not charge any big companies for making it search, so in in their interest.
However, when I was noticing a an initiative for interoperability in large companies involved, this is the top of their process for achieving it.
And first of all they needed an Inter operation agreement.
And they needed master data alignment.
And what does that mean?
That mean is the dual type of agreement for communication.
And who can afford Project which allows this type of activity to happen?
Who can afford the type of project that you describe this morning?
You have to be pretty big to afford that.
SMS are not part of this culture.
SMS has to have something completely different.
So what we are trying to achieve here in the freight wise project and also in the cooperation of the project that we are here today is a mechanism for enabling interoperability into communication.
Were also SMS may take part.

Without jeopardizing all the investments that has gone into the initiatives like popping it for the forestry industry, rosettanet for the electronics industry or debt for the car industry etc etc in intro has been mentioned, which is also a major portal for container shipping, booking and management.
They don't want to change anything because it worked perfectly for them, so we don't want to change that, but we have to make sure that other SMS can communicate with that.

At a very affordable price, that's what's behind this initiative, so we're not going to change the world, but we're going to change or provide a mechanism for Assamese to participate without the other guys having to do away with their current investments.
I will try to skip this.
So in addition to interoperability, if we are going to search for services today, many companies are almost all companies that offer description of services on the Internet that do it differently.
Lots of standardization is going on, but I have not found as of yet one way standard way of describing a transport service.

So that we may in freight without having big, centralized databases, provide booking of air tickets or booking or freight transport the way that I can currently book air tickets on the Internet, me alone, not through a travel agency.
So, so there are the first challenge we have.
Is to be able to standardize a transport service description.
When we need to communicate, we need to have a framework or a basis for communication and this basis is.
Provided by what we call the reference model.
And the reference model has a domain represented by the people who is in need of transport.

Because they obviously have a certain set of needs that need to be satisfied, there's a set of functions that they perform in order to to perform to pull up activities within this domain, and there is a domain for transport supplied.
Those who are satisfying those needs.
Within there we have those who directly work with the clients.

We also have those who are organizing the equipment, the resources that are actually needed in order to satisfy that, and we've been speaking about drivers and other people in here which are there in order to make sure that the total supply will meet the demands of the demand domain.
We also have our need an infrastructure.
And when we are talking to two.
Human fragments in customs custom is there but where in this infrastructure is customs and Customs?
Is there in regulation enforcement?
So it's a different type of communication that needs to be taking place between the transport him and domain transport supply demand and those who are then part of this deal.
Another form of infrastructure infrastructure that we need to communicate to.
We also have something which is called sector support, which is banking systems.
With this weather, weather forecasts and many other type of saying things that are not directly involved with with the transport but still.
This is as we perceive it, a complete description of anything related to transport.
Who are then involved?
And who actually have to communicate?
So far we only have identified 4.
Four different types of rolls.
And incidentally, cargo is not there.
So in my language.
Cargo Quote Intelligent cargo is cargo on which there is mounted equipment that will perform functions on behalf of one of these roles, one or more.
Becausw Frank was in onto a very important thing here, namely.
Cargo transport is not there for.
Incidentally, it's because somebody needs it.
And that's the transport user.
Somebody provides the service, that's the transport service provider and there is no integrator here.
Because the integrator or the freight forwarder or whatever you may call it, is only one who was in one hat.
Being a transport service provider and another half being a transport user when he needs somebody else to help him.
So when we're talking about communication, again, we're talking about communication only between user and service provider.
What we could have done when we sort of shape this was to say that there are certain messages in the UNC fact sweeter messages or in the UBL or out there that we will take.
We will adjust it.
But then.
We decided that it's not many times you have the chance of starting afresh and try to define what is necessary and sufficient.
To be able to communicate between these parties.
And how can we do it in such the way that information is reused as many times as possible?
Like for example, may it be that the customs people who currently are specifying their own.
Types of messages.
Could it be such that?
The information that is being exchanged between the user and the service provider.
If a copy of that was given to this customs, they would be happy.
Mostly likely they would be cause that which is part of the communication between the user and the service provider contains everything there is to know about the goods being transported.
And that's what the customers want.
So I'll stop this as well.
The.
I will not go the details, but we have defined in freight wise a number of.
Messages, information packages.
Call it whatever you want that needs to be communicating between roles.
There are very few.
If you include a message for statistics, it's 6.
And if you look at the suites of messages in EU billion UNC FAQ library.
There are much beyond that.
The type of status reporting in integrity could easily be done using.
Some of the studies reports that we've been doing here in.
In this.
Types of systems.
So let me.
We've also said that.
What we want is communication, not constraint.
So we don't want people to have to perform their activities in a certain given fashion.
We don't force business processes onto anybody.
I personally think that the item of trust.
That has been used, been used in many times.
Is is an over statement of what is needed.
So what we have done here is we have a set of very small processes enabling these few.
System information packages to be communicated in a planning execution and completion phase, and that's all we need.
What I will try to do here is.
Indicate one of the things that was a direct result of last year's loser in conference organized by your editor.
Because at that time we said that the only thing we needed to communicate between a transport user on the transports of service provider.
What do we call the transport execution plan which pose every information about the cargo it holds information about?
From and to address this and any other things that it is necessary.
It also contains the terms and.
And contracts and terms for the agreement between the user and the service provider.
And that's what I'm saying.
This is the type of information that customs should need, so there's no reason to have another one.
Maybe we need to adjust a little, but there is really no no reason to have another one.
This was a very simple thing because then there was nothing available as to what it enoree.
What movements did the cargo actually have to take?
And when you read, it just says that we would like to have that information onto the cargo.
It dawned on us that one.
I am booking my things.
My tickets on the Internet for air freight.
I'm getting my itinerary once I sort of agreed to the terms and conditions for for the transport.
So here this.

There is a good transport goods item missionary also created in order to facilitate exactly that, namely that once the agreement has been made with me and Paolo that he transports for me, he shows me through dictionary.
What is the actual path that this cargo will take throughout the network of of transport services that is available.
And this is not about terms and conditions, but it's a path.
It's is the arrival times and departure times for these individual steps, which also makes it possible to a much larger extent then to do the tracking and tracing that is necessary for you.
Richie, another party for integrity, smart CM and other projects.
What we are.
Also concerned with is information between those dealing with infrastructure and those who are providing transport services.
Frank mentioned a project called Rising which deals with inland waterway transport.
For inland waterway transport is so crucial importance that those who are planning things knows the capacity and the capability of infrastructure.
Do we have low graft?
Do you have low air draft?
What are the capacity of the locks etc etc and we have to have some way of communicating that from the infrastructure people to those offering services that's defined by the transport network status.
Those dealing with Rd transport will say that that's that datex.
And yes, obviously it's similar.
But this is a type of communication mechanism going across modes, not just for one mode.
Up we are testing this in communication with a more conventional type of operation where intra the portal for container transport management is the 1st.
Practical case for this would also having a very constructive cooperation with the Technical Committee of Transport in UBL so that we are not trying to invent wheels.

We are trying to build on core components and others that comes from all the creative works that have been going on in in UBL and in the discussion between U&C factor UBL so that we feel that we are standing on firm ground when we are actually making these final recommendations.
Thank you.
